Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The SB #22 and #24 bus stop mid-block on Clark between Madison and Monroe will be temporarily discontinued. Use Clark/Randolph or Clark/Adams for SB buses.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The southbound bus stop located mid-block on Clark between Madison and Monroe will be temporarily discontinued.

For #22 Clark and #24 Wentworth service, use either of the bus stops at Clark/Randolph or Clark/Adams.

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is temporarily discontinued due to construction. 

MAP

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #7 via Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson. NB #37 via Van Buren, Clinton, Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson. WB #7 and SB #37 buses are not affected.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound #7 Harrison buses will operate via Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson to Canal, then continue their normal route on Jackson.

Northbound #37 Sedgwick buses will operate via Van Buren, Clinton, Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson to Canal, then continue their normal route on Jackson.

Westbound #7 and southbound #37 buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

 Board Buses Here:

#7
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Jackson/Clinton

 

Bus Route

 Board Buses Here:

#37
  • Board northbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board northbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Van Buren
  • Board northbound buses on the southwest corner at Jackson/Clinton

MAP

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Changes
Alert.ShortDescription: #88 and #90 buses will not enter the Harlem (O’Hare branch) Blue Line station’s bus terminal. Board NB #88 buses at Stop F. Board SB #90 buses at Stop E.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
#88 Higgins and #90 Harlem buses will not enter the Harlem (O’Hare branch) Blue Line station’s bus terminal.

Board northbound #88 buses at Harlem/Bryn Mawr (Stop ). Southbound #88 buses are not affected.

Northbound #90 buses will end their trips at Harlem/Bryn Mawr (Stop ). Southbound #90 buses will begin their trips at Harlem/Bryn Mawr, operate via Harlem, Talcott, Sayre and Bryn Mawr, then resume their normal route on Harlem. Board southbound #90 buses on Harlem, just outside the station’s east entrance on Harlem (Stop ).

For information on service changes to Pace routes #209 and #423 visit pacebus.com.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted while we reconstruct the Harlem Blue Line station’s bus bridge over the Kennedy Expressway.

MAP

Alert.Headline: Harlem (O’Hare branch) Station’s West Entrance Temporary Closure
Alert.ShortDescription: The west entrance to the Harlem (O’Hare branch) Blue Line station on Higgins Avenue and the adjacent Park and Ride lot will temporarily close.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The west entrance to the Harlem (O’Hare branch) Blue Line station on Higgins Avenue and the adjacent Park and Ride lot will temporarily close.

To enter/exit the station and make connections with #88 Higgins and #90 Harlem buses, customers may use the east entrance on Harlem Avenue. See separately posted alerts and station signage for details.

Alternative parking is available at the Cumberland Blue Line Station (5800 N Cumberland Ave). For additional information or any questions please call (773) 714-9262 or visit Parking.com.

Why is service being changed?
The station’s west entrance and Park and Ride lot are temporarily closed while we reconstruct the Harlem Blue Line station’s bus bridge over the Kennedy Expressway.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The SB #22 and #24 bus stop on the SW corner at Clark/Lake will be temporarily discontinued.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The southbound #22 Clark and #24 Wentworth bus stop on the southwest corner at Clark/Lake will be temporarily discontinued.

For southbound #22 and #24 service, board buses one block south at Clark/Randolph.

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction and related sidewalk closures.

Alert.Headline: Austin Main Stationhouse Temporarily Closed, Use Mason Auxiliary Entrance
Alert.ShortDescription: Austin Green Line station's main stationhouse will be temporarily closed. Use temporary entrance one block east of the main stationhouse at Mason Street.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The Austin Green Line station’s main stationhouse will be temporarily closed. Please use the temporary Mason Street entrance/exit located one block east of Austin.

Why is service being changed?
The CTA is committed to making our system 100% accessible. We are installing an elevator at the Austin Green Line station as part of CTA’s All Stations Accessibility Program (ASAP) to improve system accessibility across the city and neighboring communities we serve.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: #N5 and #67 buses will operate in both directions via 67th, Cottage Grove, Marquette, Stony Island, and 67th.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
#N5 South Shore Night Bus and #67 67th/69th/71st buses will operate in both directions via 67th, Cottage Grove, Marquette, Stony Island, and 67th.

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to utility maintenance on 67th between Kenwood and Dorchester.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #146 and #148 buses will operate via State, Wacker Drive, and East Wacker Place, then resume their normal route on Michigan.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound #146 Inner Lake Shore/Michigan Express and #148 Clarendon/Michigan Express buses will operate via State, Wacker Drive, and East Wacker Place, then resume their normal route on Michigan.

Southbound #146 and #148 buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to construction at State/Lake.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #73 via Cortland, Elston, North, Kingsbury, Clifton, Clybourn, and Racine. WB via Racine, Clybourn, Sheffield, North Avenue, Elston, and Cortland.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound buses will operate via Cortland, Elston, North Avenue, Kingsbury, Clifton, and Clybourn, then resume normal route on Racine.

Westbound buses will operate Racine, Clybourn, Sheffield, North Avenue, and Elston, then resume normal route on Cortland.

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to construction on the Cortland Bridge over the Chicago River.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #66 buses will operate via Chicago, Milwaukee, Grand, Orleans, and Chicago. WB buses will operate via Chicago, Wells, Grand, Milwaukee and Chicago.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound buses will operate via Chicago, Milwaukee, Grand, and Orleans, then resume their normal route on Chicago. 

Westbound buses will operate via Chicago, Wells, and Grand, then resume their normal route on Milwaukee. 

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT construction on the Chicago Avenue viaduct.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: #126 buses will operate in both directions via Jackson, Cicero, Madison, Kostner, and Jackson.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses will operate in both directions via Jackson, Cicero, Madison, Kostner, and Jackson.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to utility work on Jackson at Kilpatrick.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #125 buses will operate via Jefferson, Washington, and Franklin, then resume their normal route on Orleans.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound buses will operate via Jefferson, Washington, and Franklin, then resume their normal route on Orleans. 

Southbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to maintenance on the Lake Street bridge over the Chicago River.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: SB 11, 49B buses operate via Western, Wilson, Lincoln, Montrose, Western, ending at Western/Eastwood. Buses will not stop at the Brown Line bus terminal.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Southbound #11 Lincoln and #49B North Western buses will operate via Western, Wilson, Lincoln, Montrose, and Western, ending their trips at Western/Eastwood. Buses will not stop at the Western Brown Line station bus terminal.

Northbound #11 and #49B buses will begin their trips at Western/Eastwood, then continue their normal route on Western.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to construction.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Jackon Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator to/from platform at the Jackson Van-Buren entrance to Jackson (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service, due to upgrading the cylinder.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator to/from platform at the Jackson Van-Buren entrance to Jackson (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service, due to upgrading the cylinder to ensure continued safe, convenient service.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Wednesday, December 31, 2025 (Note: date subject to change).

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: #8 buses will operate in both directions via Halsted, Division, Elston, Milwaukee and Halsted.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses will operate in both directions via Halsted, Division, Elston, Milwaukee and Halsted. 

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT Construction at Chicago/Halsted.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The WB #39 bus stop on the NE corner at Pershing/Morgan will be temporarily relocated to the NW corner at Pershing/Morgan.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The westbound #39 Pershing bus stop on the northeast corner at Pershing/Morgan will be temporarily relocated to the northwest corner at Pershing/Morgan. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction.

Alert.Headline: Western Loop-bound Platform Elevator Out of Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The Loop-bound platform elevator at the Western Brown Line station will be temporarily out of service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The Loop-bound platform elevator at the Western station will be temporarily out of service.

Entry/exiting from the Western Loop-bound platform will be available by escalator (entry only) and stairs only.

For accessible boarding/exiting of Loop-bound Brown Line trains:
• For service from Western, take a Kimball-bound train to Rockwell station and transfer to a Loop-bound train.

• For service to Western, take a Loop-bound train to Damen station and transfer to a Kimball-bound train.

• Use the adjacent accessible Damen and Rockwell stations.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
We are upgrading the elevator at Western to ensure continued safe, accessible service.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Tuesday, March 31, 2026. (Note: date subject to change).

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #94 buses will operate via California, North Avenue, Humbolt, and Armitage, then resume their normal route on California.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound buses will operate via California, North Avenue, Humbolt, and Armitage, then resume their normal route on California.

Southbound buses are not affected.  

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to utility maintenance on California between North Avenue and Armitage.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #44 and SB #44 bus stops are changed at Wallace/Pershing due to construction.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?

  • The northbound #44 Wallace/Racine bus stop on the southeast corner at Wallace/Pershing will be temporarily relocated to the northeast corner. 
  • The southbound #44 bus stop on the southwest corner at Wallace/Pershing will be temporarily relocated to the northwest corner. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stops are changed due to construction.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #62 and SB #62 bus stops are changed at Archer/California due to construction.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?

  • The northbound #62 Archer bus stop on the southwest corner at Archer/California will be temporarily relocated 150 feet southwest from the current bus stop. 
  • The southbound #62 bus stop on the northeast corner at Archer/California will be temporarily relocated mid-block southwest from the current bus stop. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stops are changed due to construction.

Alert.Headline: Route Change - Weekends and Holidays
Alert.ShortDescription: Eff Sun, Dec 21, #81W weekend-holiday service will not operate on Cumberland between Lawrence and Cumberland Blue Line sta. Visit transitchicago.com for info.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Weekend/holiday service on the #81W West Lawrence bus route will be modified to match the route’s weekday service.

On weekends/holidays, #81W buses will no longer operate on Cumberland between Lawrence and CTA’s Cumberland Blue Line rail station. If service on Cumberland is needed, the Pace Route 331Cumberland – 5th Avenue is available.

Why is service being changed?
Service is modified to improve access and transit connections for customers.

Alert.Headline: Route Extension
Alert.ShortDescription: Eff Sun, Dec 21, #93 bus service will be extended to serve the Logan Square Blue Line station. Visit transitchicago.com for info.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
#93 California/Dodge bus service will extend to the Logan Square Blue Line station via Kedzie, Montrose, California and Diversey.

Service will connect riders with the California Ave corridor south of Lawrence Ave, including service on #56 Milwaukee, #76 Diversey, #77 Belmont, #78 Montrose, #80 Irving Park, #94 California and #152 Addison routes.

Why is service being changed?
Service is changed to provide more transit options and expand connections for riders.

Alert.Headline: Earlier Weekday Service
Alert.ShortDescription: Beginning Mon, Dec 22, weekday #124 bus service will operate 20 minutes earlier towards Union Station. Visit transitchicago.com for details.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Weekday #124 Navy Pier service will operate 20 minutes earlier towards Union Station.

The first westbound trip towards Union Station will depart:
• Navy Pier at 8:10am
• Madison/State at approximately 8:25am

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Improved service will provide more transit options to customers.

Alert.Headline: New Morning Routing
Alert.ShortDescription: Eff Mon, Dec 22, morning bus service on #120, #121 continue south on McClurg to Grand, then Grand to Fairbanks, then normal routing. Visit transitchicago.com.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Early morning and rush period bus service on routes #120 Ogilvie/Streeterville
Express and #121 Union/Streeterville Express will continue south on McClurg
to Grand, then operate west on Grand to Fairbanks, where it will continue its
normal routing.

• Riders currently boarding on Ontario at McClurg will now board on McClurg
  at Ontario.
• Riders currently boarding on Fairbanks at Ohio will now board on Grand
  at Fairbanks.
• A new stop on Grand at McClurg will be available for riders heading towards
  Union and Ogilvie stations.

Afternoon #120, #121 service is not affected.

Why is service being changed?
Service is being modified to improve access and convenience for customers.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #60 buses will operate via Harrison and Jefferson, then resume their normal route on Washington.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound #60 Blue Island/26th buses will operate via Harrison and Jefferson, then resume their normal route on Washington.

Westbound #60 buses are not affected. 

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

Board Buses Here:

#60 Blue Island/26th
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Jackson
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Jefferson/Washington 
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Washington/Canal.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #192 buses will operate via Roosevelt, and Jefferson, ending their trips at Jefferson/Washington.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound buses will operate via Roosevelt, and Jefferson, ending their trips at Jefferson/Washington. 

Southbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: WB #124 buses will operate via Madison and Clinton, on Clinton bw Adams and Quincy. EB via Clinton, Van Buren, Jefferson, and Washington.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Westbound buses will operate via Madison and Clinton, ending their trips on Clinton between Adams and Quincy.

Eastbound buses will operate via Clinton, Van Buren, and Jefferson, then resume their normal route on Washington.

Allow extra travel time.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

Board Buses Here:

#124 Navy Pier
  • Board westbound buses on the northwest corner at Clinton/Quincy
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Jackson
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Jefferson/Washington 
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Washington/Canal. 

 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #157 buses will operate via Taylor, and Jefferson, then resume their normal route on Washington.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound buses will operate via Taylor, and Jefferson, then resume their normal route on Washington. 

Southbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

Board Buses

#157 Steeterville/Taylor
  • Board eastbound bus stop on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Taylor
  • Board eastbound bus stop on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Polk
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Jackson
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Jefferson/Washington 
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Washington/Canal. 


Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

Alert.Headline: New Schedules in Effect
Alert.ShortDescription: Beginning Sunday, December 21, updated schedules will go into effect on some CTA bus routes. See latest schedules at transitchicago.com.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Beginning Sunday, Dec 21, updated schedules will go into effect for the following bus routes. The schedules for these routes are receiving updates as part of CTA’s commitment to better meet evolving ridership needs and patterns. Most routes continue to have the same frequency and span of service, but arrival times may change up to a few minutes.

Routes with more extensive changes to hours of service are marked with an asterisk (*). Bolded routes are part of CTA’s Frequent Network.

1 Bronzeville/Union Station
2 Hyde Park Express
4 Cottage Grove
X4 Cottage Grove Express
N5 South Shore Night Bus
6 Jackson Park Express
7 Harrison
8 Halsted
9 Ashland
X9 Ashland Express
12 Roosevelt
22 Clark
24 Wentworth
28 Stony Island
30 South Chicago
36 Broadway
43 43rd
44 Wallace/Racine
48 South Damen
49 Western
X49 Western Express
50 Damen
53 Pulaski
56 Milwaukee
60 Blue Island/26th
66 Chicago
67 67th/69th/71st
72 North
75 74th-75th*
81 Lawrence
81W West Lawrence*
87 87th
90 Harlem
92 Foster
93 California/Dodge*
95 95th
100 Jeffery Manor Exp
112 Vincennes/111th
115 Pullman/115th
124 Navy Pier*
134 Stockton/LaSalle Exp
136 Sheridan/LaSalle Exp
148 Clarendon/Michigan Exp
151 Sheridan
156 LaSalle
192 U. of Chicago Hospitals Exp

*In addition, the following service changes will be implemented (see separate alerts for details):

  •  #75 74th-75th, December 21: Service will extend to the 79th/Western bus terminal via Damen Ave and 79th St.
  • #81W West Lawrence, December 21: On weekends/holidays, service will no longer operate on Cumberland between Lawrence and the Cumberland Blue Line station.
  • #93 California/Dodge, December 21: Service will extend to the Logan Square Blue Line station via Kedzie, Montrose, California and Diversey.
  • #124 Navy Pier, December 22: Weekday service will operate 20 minutes earlier towards Union Station.
  • #120 Ogilvie/Streeterville Express, #121 Union/Streeterville Express, December 22: Early morning and rush period bus service will continue south on McClurg to Grand, then operate west on Grand to Fairbanks, where it will continue its normal routing. 

Four Bus Routes Added to CTA’s Frequent Network – Effective Sun, Dec 21:
#9 Ashland, #12 Roosevelt, #72 North, and #81 Lawrence
Four routes will join CTA’s Frequent Network. This expands the network to 20 frequent routes that operate every 10 minutes or better along the entire route,6am to 9pm on weekdays and weekends, 9am to 9pm. 

New timetable brochures are posted at transitchicago.com see Schedules or call 1-888-YOUR-CTA to request a copy. For information on CTA's Frequent Network at transitchicago.com see Frequent Network.

Alert.Headline: Route Extension
Alert.ShortDescription: Eff Sun, Dec 21, #75 bus service will extend to the 79th/Western bus terminal via Damen Ave and 79th St. Visit transitchicago.com for info.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
#75 74th-75th will extend to the 79th/Western bus terminal via Damen Ave and 79th St. Service will connect riders to the Western Ave and 79th St corridors, including service on routes #49 Western, #X49 Western Express, #79 79th and Pace #349 Western Ave.

Why is service being changed?
Improved service will provide more transit options and expand connections for customers.

Alert.Headline: Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: WB #79 trips toward Ford City and Dart Container will no longer enter the 79th/Western bus terminal. Instead, WB trips will stop on the NE corner (near CVS).

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Westbound #79 79th trips toward Ford City and Dart Container will no longer enter the 79th/Western bus terminal. Instead, westbound trips will stop on the northeast corner of 79th/Western (near CVS). 

To make transfers with routes #49 Western, #X49 Western Express and Pace bus #349 South Western, walk north from 79th  to the bus terminal.

Eastbound #79 service will not change. 

Why is service being changed?
Service is being changed due to reconfiguration of the 79th/Western bus terminal.

Alert.Headline: State/Lake Elevated Station Temporary Closure
Alert.ShortDescription: Effective, Mon, Jan 5, 2026, the State/Lake Loop Elevated station will temporarily close. Please use adjacent stations at Clark/Lake or Washington/Wabash.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Effective, Monday, January 5, 2026, the State/Lake Loop Elevated station will temporarily close.

Please use the accessible Clark/Lake or Washington/Wabash stations, located within a few blocks of the State/Lake station. To transfer between the Red Line at Lake station and the Loop ‘L’ lines, use Washington/Wabash.

Why is service being changed?
The new State/Lake elevated station is scheduled to open in 2029. It will replace one of the oldest stations on the CTA rail system with a modern facility designed to improve safety, accessibility, and comfort for all riders.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Garfield Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The 63rd-bound platform elevator at Garfield (Green Line) is temporarily out-of-service. due to an electric issue.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The 63rd-bound platform elevator at Garfield (Green Line) is temporarily out-of-service. due to an electric issue.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Friday February 27,2026 (Note: date subject to change).

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Damen Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator between the street and all trains at Damen (Green Line) is temporarily out-of-service due to repairs.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator between the street and all trains at Damen (Green Line) is temporarily out-of-service due to repairs.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Wednesday December 31, 2025 (Note: date subject to change).

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Damen Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator to/from the Harlem- bound platform at Damen  (Green line) is temporarily out-of-service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator to/from the Harlem-bound platform at Damen (Green line) is temporarily out-of-service.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Wednesday December 31, 2025 (Note: date subject to change).

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: Added Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The #9 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network for buses.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
10% more service Saturdays.

The #9 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network. Buses will operate every 10 minutes or better along the entire route, 6am to 9pm on weekdays and 9am to 9pm on weekends.


For information on CTA's Frequent Network at transitchicago.com see Frequent Network.

Why is service being changed?
Service is being improved as part of CTA’s new Frequent Network for buses.

Alert.Headline: Added Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The #12 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network for buses.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
15% more service Saturdays.

25% more service Sundays/holidays.

The #12 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network.

Buses will operate every 10 minutes or better along the entire route, 6am to 9pm on weekdays and 9am to 9pm on weekends.


For information on CTA's Frequent Network at transitchicago.com see Frequent Network.

Why is service being changed?
Service is being improved as part of CTA’s new Frequent Network for buses.

Alert.ShortDescription: The #81 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network for buses.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
10% more service weekdays and Saturdays.

25% more service Sundays/holidays.

The #81 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network. Buses will operate every 10 minutes or better along the entire route, 6am to 9pm on weekdays and 9am to 9pm on weekends.


For information on CTA's Frequent Network at transitchicago.com see Frequent Network.

Why is service being changed?
Service is being improved as part of CTA’s new Frequent Network for buses.

Alert.ShortDescription: The #72 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network for buses.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
10% more service weekdays and Saturdays.

25% more service Sundays/holidays.

The #72 route is now part of CTA’s new Frequent Network. Buses will operate every 10 minutes or better along the entire route, 6am to 9pm on weekdays and 9am to 9pm on weekends.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Addison Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator at Addison (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service due to elevator upgrades.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator at Addison (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service due to elevator upgrades.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Friday February 27, 2026 (Note: date subject to change).

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: #J14 Jeffery Jump Temporary Reroute near Jeffery/73rd
Alert.ShortDescription: J14 Jeffery Jump buses are rerouted in both directions: due to street blockage near Jeffery/73rd.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#J14 Jeffery Jump buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions: 

Northbound via Jeffery, 73rd, Yates, 71st, Jeffery, and resume normal route.
Southbound via Jeffery, 67th, Stony Island, 73rd, Jeffery and resume normal route due to street blockage near Jeffery/73rd.

Allow extra travel time.

Alert.Headline: #15 Jeffrey Local Temporary Reroute near Jeffery/73rd
Alert.ShortDescription: 15 Jeffrey Local buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions due to: street blockage near Jeffery/73rd.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#15 Jeffrey Local buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions: 

Northbound via Jeffery, 73rd, Yates, 71st, Jeffery, and resume normal route.
Southbound via Stony Island, 67th, Jeffery, 71st, Dorchester, 73rd and Jeffery and resume normal route due to street blockage near Jeffery/73rd.

Allow extra travel time.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Bryn Mawr (Main Entrance) Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator at Bryn Mawr (Red Line-Main Entrance) is temporarily out-of-service due to repairs.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator at Bryn Mawr (Red Line-Main Entrance) is temporarily out-of-service due to repairs.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Wednesday December 31, 2025. (Note: date subject to change).

Consider using the elevator at the Hollywood entrance to Bryn Mawr.

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Davis Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The Howard- and Loop- bound platform elevator at Davis (Purple Line) is temporarily out-of-service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The Howard- and Loop- bound platform elevator at Davis (Purple Line) is temporarily out-of-service.

Our crews are working to assess the repair time for this elevator—this alert will be updated with additional information if/when we can estimate its return to service.

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: #34 South Michigan Temporary Northbound Reroute near Michigan/101st
Alert.ShortDescription: Northbound 34 South Michigan buses are rerouted via Michigan, 101st, State,100th, Michigan, over normal route, due to street blockage near Michigan/101st.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Northbound #34 South Michigan buses are temporarily rerouted via Michigan, 101st, State, 100th, Michigan, over normal route, due to street blockage near Michigan/101st.

Southbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Clark/Lake Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator at 203 N. LaSalle (Brown and Harlem-bound Green Line platform from street and subway concourse) at Clark/Lake is temporarily out-of-service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator at 203 N. LaSalle (Brown and Harlem-bound Green Line platform from street and subway concourse) at Clark/Lake is temporarily out-of-service.

Our crews are working to assess the repair time for this elevator—this alert will be updated with additional information if/when we can estimate its return to service.

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: Howard bound Red Line Service Delayed at North/Clybourn
Alert.ShortDescription: Howard bound Red Line trains are standing at North/Clybourn due to police activity. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Howard bound Red Line trains are standing at North/Clybourn due to police activity.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Alert.Headline: Howard bound Red Line Service Resuming Normal Routing
Alert.ShortDescription: Howard bound Red Line service is resuming its normal routing, via the subway, btwn Fullerton & Cermak-Chinatown after an earlier reroute.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Howard bound Red Line service is resuming its normal routing, via the subway, between Fullerton & Cermak-Chinatown.

Trains were temporarily rerouted via the elevated lines due to police activity.

Allow extra travel time.

CTAAlerts.ErrorMessage: There are no active alerts based on your filter criteria

Alert.Headline: Sunday/Holiday Schedule on Thursday, December 25, 2025
Alert.ShortDescription: Bus and rail service will operate on a Sunday/Holiday schedule on Thursday, December 25, 2025 (Christmas Day)

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Bus and rail service will operate on a Sunday/Holiday schedule on Thursday, December 25, 2025 (Christmas Day).

Alert.Headline: #70 Division Temporary Reroute at Division/Menard
Alert.ShortDescription: 70 Division buses are temporarily rerouted via  Division, Central, Augusta and Austin: due to, fire department activity near Division/Menard.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#70 Division buses are temporarily rerouted via  Division, Central, Augusta and Austin: due to, fire department activity near Division/Menard.

Allow extra travel time.

Our crews are working to assess the repair time for this elevator—this alert will be updated with additional information if/when we can estimate its return to service.
